Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Camll
Reviews.Content: This staff at Barberini Hotel is fantastic. Can't say enough about the service. We had numerous special requests and they always came to our rescue. We traveled on a mom/daughter trip. There were 4 of us. My friend's mom accidentally dropped her bracelet down the drain the night before leaving. Of course we were pressed to get to the airport, reported the situation and expected we would never see the bracelet again. The staff not only retrieved the bracelet, but mailed it back to the US. This type of service is what sets this hotel far apart from the others. We hope to return someday. By the way, the location and breakfast was fantastic too!

Reviews.Title: “Service. Staff. Location. What else?”
Reviews.Author: Adrian J
Reviews.Content: As we arrived very late, we were accommodated in a temporary room which was quite small, but adequate. However, the next day we moved to a larger room which was very nice. From the start, the staff were very helpful and kind. In fact, they they really made the time in the hotel a pleasure. The loction of the hotel is also very convenient, in that we walked EVERYWHERE, and yet it was all walking distance. Also, Rome is not a particularly quiet place, but this was just far enough away from the major attractions that we could sleep. I don't quite understand why people complain about room sizes. I didn't go to Rome to look at the inside of a hotel room! If that is important to you then perhaps you should get a life and get out more! One more thing... (I know I'm going on a bit).... My wife and I would like to thank the staff for contributing to make this a most memorable trip. I will go back, and I will (if possible) stay in the Barberini! 10/10 ........Room 304, 24-31 March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ka5284
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. It's centrally located - we could walk everywhere (even to Vatican city), has free internet and an extensive breakfast buffet (we had so much food for our long days of sightseeing). Breakfast was included with our rate which was ideal. The room was clean and the bathroom was updated. The receptionist were really helpful and recommended a restaurant next door which was a good value. All in all, a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with free internet”
Reviews.Author: oraldina
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, very close to Fontana di Trevi. I was lucky to pay about 100 euro for a single room but prices may be up to even 300 euro, depending on the period you go there. Breakfast is American breakfast and it takes place on an indoor terrace with an excellent view on Rome. Breakfast was included in the room price. Internet is free. The room was very clean, very good heating in winter, bathroom excellent too. Minibar a little bit too overpriced (7 euro for a very small bottle of liqueur). I arrived at about 22.30 and asked to drink something at the bar but even though it seemed open, the receptionist told me it was closed, encouraging me to use the room minibar, which of course was more expensive. They have also a spa. Underground is at 50 meters. So overall the judgment is positive.

Reviews.Title: “A very good centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bavaria34
Reviews.Content: Very well located, great breakfast room, rooms are very clean but a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “No hesititation in staying again”
Reviews.Author: Revaet
Reviews.Content: Terrific location near metro/bus station and an easy walk to Trevi, Vatican and forum. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were gracious and comfortable. We had a nice view of st. Peters from our window only surpassed by the views from the 6th flr dining room. Breakfast was extensive with very attentive staff. I would stay again without hesititation.

Reviews.Title: “No 24 hours service”
Reviews.Author: Okyfb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights with my family. Hotel and rooms were small but pretty. However at night my son accedently dropped a bottle water in bed, there were no housekeeping to change the bed... Also i didnt like the blanket, it was so itchy...

Reviews.Title: “Do not trust this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glen A
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying at this hotel in August 2011. Our travel agent had booked the hotel through email correspondence with the front desk but did not book it through the on-line reservation system. BIG MISTAKE. The hotel took this opportunity to book a much higher rate (double the rate quoted in the email) onto the reservation system. When confronted about the inconsistency, the staff played dumb (what is a travel agent?), said they did not understand English or better yet, we did not receive any email from your travel agent. In any event, we advised our credit card company of their fraudulent behaviour which could be verified through the email string between the hotel and our travel agent. Lesson learned - ensure the rate has been agreed upon at the time of check in and AVOID THIS HOTEL. In all honesty, I could not even remember what this hotel was like given the bad experience we had. Our travel agent has also advised all of their clients to avoid this hotel and has taken the extra step of broadcasting a warning to all of their affiliated travel agencies across Canada. I hope the warnings and bad publicity costs this hotel a lot more than the extra euros they overcharged us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice roof top view at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: traveler10131
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and stayed at Barberini Hotel. We were satisfied. Room clean. Shower too small for us. Wi fi worked well but with our lap top at the our desk my husband couldn't get behind me because the bed was too close. However, one can't have everything. It's a big city so what we want to pay doesn't go very far. Better than a room we had in Paris. Has elevator which was essential for my knees. Staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the breakfast room alone!”
Reviews.Author: cmd123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in October, 2011. It was a great choice. Our room was small, the bathroom pretty large, new and all marble. Everything was very crisp and clean. The location was excellent, just a half a block from the Piazza Barberini. It's within walking distance of both the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. (Both were so crowded when we were there, you could barely see anything.) It's also right across the street from the Plazzo Barberini--a wonderful palace with magnificent art work and the most fabulous fresco ceilings! And no crowds. The Hop-on-Hop-off buses stop at he Piazza Barberini, there is also a taxi stand there, as well as a subway stop. We had planned to do the "Hop" bus, but we found that taxis were inexpensive and were a better alternative, since you didn't have to wait for the bus. The breakfast room is on the 6th floor, with a wall of windows over looking Rome to the west, including a great view of the dome of St. Peter's. There were lots of choices for breakfast, from scrambled eggs and cereal to the most delicious pastries ever. This is a great room! The hotel has free wi-fi, and also a computer available if you don't have your own device. The front desk was very accommodating. As soon as we arrived, we asked them to get us reservations to visit the Villa Borghese and also for a tour of the Vatican Museum. They did both immediately and graciously. Before we left home, we contacted them by email and asked them to arrange for a car to meet us at the cruise port at Civitavecchia. They made the arrangements for us, and it cost less than our travel agent could arrange. They also arranged for a car to take us to the airport. This was a very satisfactory stay. Good restaurants in the neighborhood (one the Hosteria) was excellent! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Gailb772
Reviews.Content: We booked in Feb 2011 and on arrival in October were told there had been an error on our booking that had only been picked up that morning! They were very gracious and transferred us to a sister hotel (free taxi)after being offered a free drink. The Empire Palace was fabulous, I recommend it but the whole experience spoilt our first impression. It was a special birthday celebration and it fell a bit flat. When we arrived at the Barberini our friends had a disappointing experience with the cleanliness of the bathroom, the toilet in particular had a brown residue in the bowl yet the cleaning 'seal' was intact.The hotel was quiet, we wanted a drink in the fabulous terrace bar/restaurant but there was no-one there. They kindly sent Roberto to serve us drinks and he was extremely friendly and to be commended on his customer service, but we felt 'in the way', it isn't obviously something that happens often! Other than that, I would say for the money there are better hotels in better locations.

Reviews.Title: “Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: dandiham
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel in the center of Rome Close to everything, including metro, subway, Buses and trains. Room was very large with a Italian flare to it. Restaurant on the 6th floor. Had a gorgeous view of the city. Breakfast was very good. Wireless internet did not work in room, had to go downstairs to lobby area to receive an connection. Seem that everyone was having the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwipacker
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 night in this hotel after reading reviews form Trip Advisor, We thought that the roof top breakfast room would be fresh air but it was a closed in airconditioned room. Our first impression was that it was a bit grubby. The lift was dirty. needed vacuuming and the dirty marks on the stairs and around light switches needed a good clean. Our first room when we stayed 4 nights had a view over the palace but it was so small and the bed was hard! The staff were courteeous but unfriendly. Not warm and welcoming as we had hoped. However there was great young man who was helpful . He had good english and seemed to know evrything we needed to know. Sadly he wasn't always on duty. The hotel was expensive and we thought 4 star meant the staff would have quite good english but this was not so. They often couldn't understand what we were asking about. We returned to the hotel(prebooked and prepaid ) for one night before we left Italy and the room was dreadful. It felt like a holding pen for sheep. We had an airconditioning unit outside our window and it was noisy. There was no view, only a run down exterior wall about a meter or 2 away.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: DianaNewYorkNY
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Barberini Hotel nine years ago, and absolutely loving it, I decided to stay there again on my recent visit to Rome with three friends. I couldn't have been more disappointed - a once lovely hotel is now tired and worn and underwhelming. Carpets on stairs are threadbare and furniture in lobby is due for a thorough cleaning. The rooftop bar that was advertised in hotel literature does not exist, despite hotel staff telling us that it was open daily. Breakfast was nice and wait staff in the breakfast room were attentive. Room assignments were not the greatest - one guest in our party was assigned a handicapped room without prior notification and another room overlooked an interior courtyard with a restaurant (and accompanying food smells). And don't ask staff for restaurant recommendations -- they will send you next door for a mediocre meal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Barberini”
Reviews.Author: izzipip
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night break in Rome, staying at the Hotel Barberini. The hotel is in an excellent location, within 5 mins walk to both the spanish steps and the Trevi Fountain. It also only took us approx 45 mins to walk to the Vatican, and about 20-25 minutes to walk to the Coloseum. In fact, it was such a good location, we never got a cab/metro whilst we were sight seeing. The Hotel was very clean, the room was a little on the small side with no view, but that didn't matter to us as we were hardly in the room! The reception staff were very attentive on arrival, and our room was ready. The breakfast room is a delight, up on the 6th floor with impressive views. We used the jacuzzi one one day, and didn't realise you would get charged for this, but it was only 15 euros and well worth it on those aching legs and feet! I would also like to mention a small jazz bar/restaurant, down on the main street, turn left when you reach Barberini Square and its there on the left hand side - called something like Enoteca! They had a small jazz band on each night, which was really enjoyable, and not overpriced like some places we went to.!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel at a nice place”
Reviews.Author: TQuest79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located (near the subway and bus stops). Rooms are clean and comfortable. They made a mistake with my reservation and in the first night put me and my wife in two separated single rooms, but they moved us to a nice couple room the day after. This episode was frustrating, but the staff tried to make their best to apologize and offered us a spa session, which we asked to change for a dinner. Although they don't serve dinner, they arranged a nice supper with wine, different kinds of bread, cheese, ham, salad, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TEDPALUC
Reviews.Content: The location is great for seeing all sites in Rome. The price per night was very good for this area of Rome. The rooms were a good size for Rome and although not new were very clean. The staff was extremely fiendly and helpful. Breakfast came with the room, and diningroom is located on the 6th floor, nice view of city during breakfast and a great start to our day.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Hotel Barberini”
Reviews.Author: Dee1981DerryCity
Reviews.Content: We have returned from our first stay in Rome, where we got married. We stayed at Hotel Barberini. The staff were extremely helpful. They could not have done more for us. The rooms were excellent, with a lovely view of rome from the top floor restaurant. Location wise the hotel was brilliant. We very close to all the major sites, or a short ride from them. The weather was fantastic and there is so much to see and do. I would recommend this hotel highly. There was an extra charge to use the sauna and steam rooms however, we were aware of this prior to booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan P
Reviews.Content: Hotel is basically right in the center of Rome. Less than a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. Room was pretty small but its expected for Rome. Bathroom was a good size. Overall the room was comfortable. Internet was a plus. Breakfast on the 6th floor was very enjoyable. Staff were friendly. I would return here for the location and value.

Reviews.Title: “a good *** hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Gideon B
Reviews.Content: Great location-small room-good breakfast on 6th floor+city views-bath needed care-friendly reception-almost NO public space-GOOD value for money Gideon

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: velissarios1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights.it was a great 4 star hotel 5 minutes away from fontana di trevvi with an out standing breakfast.However, the room was a little bit small but very clean and attractive.It has got central airconditioning which was quiet and effective.In my oppinion the hotel would be rated as a good 3 star hotel rather than 4 star. To sum up i would suggest this hotel to my friendsif the prise would be more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rich46503
Reviews.Content: Met our expectations and exceeded them in some respects. The colored marble floors in the reception area indicates a quality throughout. Professional service in all respects. Rooms well fitted with comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The breakfast room is on top floor with terrific vista over Rome. From the hotel we were able to walk anywhere, great gelato store on the corner of Barberini square nearby, and the up market restaurants of Via Veneto within easy reach. We'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good, location”
Reviews.Author: bellagio_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barberini is well located near the Spanish Steps and area attractions. Rooms are small but comfortable. The only problem was with the taxi ordered through the hotel staff to the Vatican. The taxi ordered thru the hotel charged double (on the meter) than the taxi we took back. Norm B

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Clairejones81
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise for my husbands birthday. When we arrived, the reception team had remembered this from the booking info I had provided and within 5 mins of gong to our room, has arranged for a bottle of champagne to be delivered which was lovely. Reception very helpful, breakfast staff very friendly and location ideal, close to the metro and within easy walking distance of many attractions. Would highly recommend this clean, friendly hotel and would have no hesitation in staying here again or recommending to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location, somewhat overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CobbKappa
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here for 3 days after our East Med cruise. The location was great, the breakfast included with the stay was great, room was nice sized but overall still seemed somewhat overpriced even by European standards. Marco P was very helpful when we had questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaPT
Reviews.Content: Location was good for walking to attractions, taking the metro or using the bus system. The breakfast was good and nice in the rooftop dining area. The room was adequate size for Italy. Marco P. at the front desk was very helpful and kind. The only downside is that I thought it was very overpriced for the accommodations and location. I did a great deal of research on Rome hotels before I settled on the Hotel Barberini using tripadvisor and then after seeing the other hotels that I researched with location and cost this hotel was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: michelle190725
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 3 night stay here with a friend, I was quite anxious before having read some of the reviews here, I need not have been, fantastic location for everywhere we didn't need to use public transport at all, up a quiet street just off the main hussle and bussle of Rome. Room was a standard twin with plenty of space and very clean, only missing tea making facilities which would have been nice after ong days out pacing the streets of Rome, all staff encountered were very polite and professional, we even hd a breakfast bag made up for us as we had a 6.30 tour start time. Breakfast was ok, good selection but as others have previously stated after 10am not much left. Having seen some of the other areas and hotels on our airport shuttle drop offs I couldn;t have been more pleased with this one even though we spent very little time in it and Rome itself one of my favourite places and I fully intend to return and stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance to most highlights!”
Reviews.Author: Tunika
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is with no doubt the location. It lies within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Colosseum. Otherwise the hotel is nice and clean, with typical italian style in the rooms. The breakfast is adequate with a selection of bread, cheese, cereals, sweets, fruits and egg/bacon. NOTE: We arrived at 10 o'clock one day, and at that time most of the egg/cheese was gone. This was quite disappointing since breakfast lasts until 11 o'clock. Having said that, the waiters in the breakfast hall were very professional, and the view is great - breakfast is served in 6th flloor. The receptionist were all service minded and polite - apart from one person. This, and the lack of refill of breakfast foods, were small minuses on an otherwise really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if you get a spacious room, but a nightmare if you get the broom cupboard!”
Reviews.Author: misstravel39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sept 2010 for 3 nights. The Hotel itself was very nice. But we were placed in a room that was way too small even to accomodate our luggage. It was unacceptable. Apparently there is at least one room like this on each floor and if you are unlucky enough to get it then it is a nightmare for 2 people. We asked to be moved. The next day they moved us to a standard room which was much bigger and really lovely. If they had have put us in this room from the beginning we would have been impressed! The rooftop room for breakfast was lovely with great views and we got wifi access. The main spa never seemed to be working........we got the impression this may have been going on for some time and wonder if it is ever is in operation - we don't know. Ironically, one of the reasons we booked this Hotel was because it had a Spa! The location was walking distance to most places and this was a major plus. The staff organised a taxi to the airport for us at the end of our 3 night stay, and this was most prompt and helpful. Overall, as long as you get a standard room and not the broom cupboard room, and the spa is working, this would be a really good place to stay. The low rating I gave this place is due to the spa not working and the tiny unacceptable room we were given on the first night - this is just not good enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: DrRad_11
Reviews.Content: Our family (parents,kids 10,11) spent 6 nights in Hotel Barberini junior suite. There was enough space in the room and it was clean and comfortable. Some traffic noise in the room but in Rome that cant be avoided. We had little balcony facing palazzo barberini. The breakfast was good, plenty to choose from and the view from breakfast room magnificent. The location of the hotel was also very good, most of the sights within walking distance. The staff was very friendly. We were on holiday, so we didn´t need any internet connections. We can recommend this hotel if you travel with kids, and next time we come to Rome we propably choose Barberini...

Reviews.Title: “style”
Reviews.Author: remydoyle
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel. The room was great with a view of the Basilica. Rooftop breakfast was very good. We were a little late but they made up breakfast for us. Same street as the Trevi Fountain. The hop off bus a street over, Very central with a museum right ascross the street. Worth the money. Staff was very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: ostaragirl
Reviews.Content: After arriving at 10pm at night dying to get into our room, we were greeted by apologies that 'the computer had broke down and they had let our room!', considering we had booked back in January found it hard to believe. Think they must have a got offer of a better price for the night. Anway we were taken by taxi to another hotel, which actually turned out to be much more plush than Barberini, next day we were given a room back there. Very stressful start to the holiday!. On the surface the hotel was ok, clean enough, although minimal cleaning of the rooms and change of sheets. Breakfast was ok but basicish.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Qtrhorses
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a jr suite with our two teenagers, king bed with single sofa bed and single trundle. Room and bathroom were lovely and clean. room was large enough for the four of us. Breakfast was wonderful and the wait staff very pleasant and helpful. Location for sight seeing is excellent. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, wonderful breakfast in rooftop setting”
Reviews.Author: ame21
Reviews.Content: Everything we could have wished for in a city break. We love to walk around so location is key and we were not disappointed. Five minutes to metro, ten minutes to trevi fountain, fifteen to spanish steps. Once supplied with map wandered around seeing as many sights as we could. Reception helpful, all staff couldn't do enough. Made for the rooftop bar at 6pm for a drink before eating out, wonderful atmosphere seeing Rome lit up. Lovely choice of restaurants all around area. Weather in April was beautiful too! Rome was busy but not too busy to be able to get around, have a gelato or find a table for coffee whenever we wanted. Lovely break ... definitely go back to Barberini Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Westportbarbara
Reviews.Content: Despite the thieving cabdrivers in Rome, we had a great stay in this hotel. The service was professional, friendly and accommodating. The rooms are smallish like most real European hotels, but beautifully laid out and decorated. If you want a hotel that makes you feel like you are staying in a place as nice as your own home, this is it. Delicious breakfast, quiet rooms, sparkling clean, and lovely bathrooms--Just really nice after a long flight to not have to say yuck, but "oh yeah!"

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of July 2010. It was centrally located and the service was very good. Located near the Barbarini stop, it was easy to get around via subway or walking to the main pedestrian area.The breakfast was European style, but good every day. The room was clean and we had no issues with our bed. The room was small, but that is to be expected. I don't come to Rome to sit in my hotel room. I would come back if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “truly 4 star hotel that meets all our needs”
Reviews.Author: georgeau
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a slope up from Piazza Barberini with the mass transit station and taxi stand nearby. We can walk to Trevi fountain, gallery borghese, panteon and Piazza Navona and it is away from the crowds at Spanish steps. The hotel staff are a group of young staffers with friendly attitude and helpful demeanours. The hotel does not have a restaurant or too many services but the breakfast is good and the rooms are in good condition and the bathrooms are clean . This fits all our needs and we took the taxi to the airport for 40 euros as ordained by law.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vince1900
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in this hotel as a guest of my Italian cousin from Piemonte. She made all the arrangements. I was thrilled with the place. Staff at the desk was excellent. All were fluent in English and we spoke only English even though I am conversant in Italian. They were polished, friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful in every way. The hotel is smallish and the rooms are smallish. But all is elegant and very, very clean. We had two single rooms which were totally adequate since we were mostly out and about. The bathroom was roomy and very nicely done. I used my laptop in the room but did not have time for TV so cannot say if that was satisfactory. The bed was firm and of good quality. I slept very well. (Had a very quiet inside room). The rooftop breakfast room is beautiful and has astounding views of the city. The buffet was more than adequate and I routinely overate on the three mornings I was there. I could not resist trying lots of delicious things. Contrary to what others said, I did not see any rudeness from the breakfast room staff. They all seemed genuinely eager to help us. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! I cannot comment on value since I did not pay or see the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful hotel with great breakfast views”
Reviews.Author: awolkiwis
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for a long weekend.lovely food and very good service at breakfast time particularly. Stunning view to St Peter's basilica and other domes from the roof top breakfast restaurant. Really good location for public transport. 10 minutes walk to Termini, main bus and train station. Also 5 minutes from the nearest hop on hop off bus tour stops. Rooms can be really small in parts of Europe but ours was very resonable size in this hotel. Paid 85 per night inclusing breakfast which I consider good value for money. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: BluePacDog
Reviews.Content: Delightful boutique hotel on Via Rasella is close (just a few blocks) to Fontana de Trevi and the Spanish Steps. Piazza Barberini and one of Bernini's fabulous fountains is just a block away. Close to Metro, restaurants and some of the worlds best shopping! The staff was friendly and quite helpful. Room was fairly small by American standards but from a European standpoint, perfect. When in Rome as they say! Good size marble bath with tub/shower, sink toilet and bidet. Room had french doors opening onto small balcony (5th floor). View of Pantheon and Basilica from balcony. Comfortable bed, mini bar and TV. (even has 1 or 2 english channels). Breakfast is served buffet style on roof in an enclosed glass room with splendid view, again, of the rooftops of Rome extending to St. Peter's. Breakfast is ample with a wide selection of italian favorites as well as some american standards like eggs and bacon. The hotel is perfectly situated in my opinion. We walked to every possible corner of Rome and never took a cab. Great way to explore the city! Had a terrific stay and will certainly return after saving our pennies. Molto Bene.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kellew1
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely delighted with this hotel. It is a lovely position being in a quieter setting but only a short walk to all the places of interest. The bedrooms are a suitable size and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was very clean and had everything you would expect. The roof terrace restaurant where continental breakfast was served was gorgeous and had terrific views across the rooftops of Rome. We would definately stay here again and thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall, but ....”
Reviews.Author: critique007
Reviews.Content: Rooms were on the small side, but not too surprising, considering it is Rome. The bathtub did not have a sufficient screen so the entire bathroom was wet after showering. We had booked a tour of the Vatican for 7:15AM, booked with the concierge who was very accommodating. He had informed us that we could go to breakfast as early as 6:45AM (it starts at 7AM) so that we would not be late for our tour. Upon arriving at breakfast at 6:50AM, we were refused service and kicked out of the breakfast room! The waiter was very arrogant, unaccommodating, and we will not forget his attitude. Whatever his problem was, we did not deserve this treatment. Ruined my day. The location was good, close to the the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, however, we had to climb a hill with our luggage upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Promises too much, provides very little”
Reviews.Author: exptheworld
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel after reviewing the comments on tripadvisor and other web sites. We hated our stay. Rooms are tiny and not well kept. TV does not even offer a single English news channed other than Bloomsberg. B/f, althogh included is bad - invariable running out of food items. Miserably under staffed and not able to give any room service - actually we had to make trips to a pantry type kitchen on 6th flr to get water, etc. Staff is demotivated and over-worked. As per them, the owner is unwilling to hire additional people for help. Rooms are noisy and although rooms were avalalbe on higher floors, we were given rooms on 1st floor and did not change even after we requested. We do not have experience of other hotels in Rome, but would never come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel, excellent breakfast and wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: JaneEJohnson
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 weeks in Italy and started our trip at the Barberini. I relied heavily on Tripadvisor reviews for booking all 7 of our great hotels and i want to provide the same service for future travelers. This was the perfect place for us. We booked 2 rooms and both were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. They helped us book tours, called taxis, and gave us all the information we needed for a great stay. Ricardo, was especially helpful and gave us some restaurant and sightseeing recommendations. This hotel was perfect for our family. My search parameters were: Non-smoking, individual air-conditioning, modern bathroom, mini-bar or frig in room ( my husband is diabetic and needs to store insulin) central location and wi-fi preferred.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Raspich
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel within easy distance of lots of the main attractions. There was a mix up when we arrived but the reception staff had already organised for us to be in another hotel for the night. Okay this was inconvenient; however we had an upgrade as a result and it was dealt with, with such sincere apologies that i can't hold it against them. The staff were lovely and very friendly - nothing was too much effort. Breakfast was very tasty and plentiful - the breakfast room has lovely views. The rooms are small but perfectly formed and to be honest no different that you might expect in London. Our bed was bigger than expected and very comfy, the bathroom was large and very clean. Generally we were very pleased and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NISOZ
Reviews.Content: After we decided on going to Italy I had checked all tripadvisor comments for Italy hotels. Thanks to Tripadvisor we made reservation in Hotel Barberini. This was a perfect choice. the hotel was great, the breakfast was perfect. Hotel staff so kind and so helpful and welcoming. I recommend to everyone.If I go to Italy again I will stay in Hotel Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreXenofonte
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, comfortable, would recommend. I've been at this hotel for six nights. The staff was incredible, patient, with a real desire to help. The room was large and comfortable, the bathroom very good. I had some difficulties with the use of TV. The location is perfect. Walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Piazza Barberini, Crypt of the Capuchins, spagna stairs and beside the metro station Barberini. The breakfast is served on the sixth floor with a beautiful view of the city and an awesome buffet. There is not a large hotel. Wi-Fi only on lobby. Free Internet access on lobby.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: LisaM624
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in April and asked for 2 beds as it was just my son and I . When we got there they only had a king size bed available for us. We had to stay in that room for one night and then they changed our room for our next 2 nights. The beds were hard as rocks and the rooms were tiny. I had also booked a tour to the vatican that they confirmed online. They had no record of that. We were promised it would be okay and would get the tour anyway the next morning. The next morning no one knew anything about that promise, but they did get someone to come get us at the last minute and we got on the tour which we were late for. Then I gave them my sons laundry. They said they would have it that night or the next morning. When I called the next morning they said we couldnt have it till that evening. When I had a fit they got it in 2 hours and charged me 72 euros! but sentup a basket of fruit. There was one guy at the desk, Riccardo, who was very nice to us. He recommended the best restaurant we went to in Italy. (sorry, forgot the name). He seemed to really care. He was the hotels one good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, in the historical center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: carinaBucharest
Reviews.Content: I reccomend this hotel to everyone who wants to stay near the important turistic objectives of Rome, in very good conditions of accomodation. The hotel is very quiet when the windows are closed, but not even when they are open the noise is not very big because the hotel faces a secondary street. Anyway there is some noise froms the motocicles - but this is a common thing in every capital. The hotel is clean, the breakfast is very good, and on the top of the building, from where you can see an important part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: SandL11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights from May 18 to May 23 for the second part f our honeymoon. We absolutely loved this hotel. The location could not be any better. You are close to the metro (which we only took twice, you can walk everywhere), restaurants, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and a slew of other places. Rome is a beautiful city so regardless of where you are there is always something to see. The hotel is very clean and the staff are wonderful. They will give you restaurant recommendations and also show you the best routes to get to the attractions. The roof top terrace has the most amazing fews of the city and yes, the Vatican. The breakfast was great. You can get scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, bread, donuts, croissants, yogurts, etc. There is plenty of selection, and the service is great. The rooms are small but big enough to accomodate luggages and the like. We really like the rooms, they felt very Italian! The are two things that I didn't like. I found the bed to be very hard and it wasn't the most confortable. That's my opinion, though, my husband liked it. There are many people that prefer a hard bed. Also, there is free wifi in the hotel but if you have an iPhone you can only use it on the roof top terrace and in the lobby. The free wifi in the rooms is only if you have a laptop and they provide the proper cables. Our room was not facing the street so we didn't have any problems with noise. We were really impressed with this hotel and the service. We highly recommend it and would not think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with a great breakfast and good location”
Reviews.Author: travelinjack3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days at the end of April 2010 at the end of our week in Italy. The location is very nice being so close to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and easy walking distance to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona plus other places. The rooms were very plush and elegant. The bathroom was nice but did have a bit of mildew in the grout between some of the tiles. As stated by others the view at breakfast was grand. The breakfast itself was very very nice but the coffee was not as good as the other places we stay in Italy. I would gladly stay here again even though it didn't have the "personal service" feel of the smaller places that preceded it in our trip. It is also right across the street from a small museum with some fantastic art pieces.

Reviews.Title: “The views at breakfast are worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Northamptonmark
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant small hotel within 2 minutes of Barberini Piaza, metro line, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. Very central, giving it a perfect location for your Rome holiday. The staff were very friendly. Breakfast is served on the top floor (6th floor) - you have amazing views of the roof tops of Rome, you can see the Vatican and a number of other domes. We loved our breakfast views. Breakfast itself was nice although don't be fooled by the "American breakfast" - this is made up of scrambled egg, hot dog sausage (sometimes) and bacon. The rest of breakfas is a general typical Continental breakfast. Coffee is great and the service excellent (although most of it is buffet style). You can have a drink up there in the evening but there is no restaurant. The hotel must have been recently renovated as it all looks very clean and smart. Rooms are not big (they never are in European cities) but very pleasant. Can be noisy with the street (so if you are a light sleeper take ear plugs). Internet access is free but in the evenings it can be slow to non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel- will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTriprater
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Barberini for four nights at the beginning of March 2010 during our trip to Rome. When we arrived at the hotel, I informed them that my suitcase had been lost by the airline. They immediately took our information and offered to call the airline every few hours in order to make sure they got us our suitcase as soon as possible. They even called our room to update us when the bag had been found, and it was delivered the next day. The front desk staff was so helpful not only with the luggage, but also with restaurant recommendations, directions to different sights, etc. They really made us feel at home. The room was pretty small, but impeccably decorated in a very authentic Italian style. It was extremely clean and the bathroom was a good size with a towel heater. The only downsides were that the water did leak on to the floor from the shower, and it was warm in the room. We opened the windows to our balcony though, and were very comfortable at night. The breakfast was wonderful and the room on the 6th floor had an amazing view that we loved to see every morning. The location of the hotel was fantastic, just a few minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain. It felt very safe walking around the area at night, and we were able to walk to almost all areas of the city. We love taking long walks, but we were also only about a block away from the metro for those people who would rather take the metro. Overall, we had an amazing time in Rome and the Hotel Barberini was the perfect hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: deboravh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! Beautiful room, modern bathroom, few steps from tne Trevi Fountain and main atractions of the city, great breakfast, free cable internet on the room (cable provided), would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding and would revisit anytime”
Reviews.Author: LeGrandSydney
Reviews.Content: We were initially at an un-named dreadful and overpriced hotel very close by. The Baberini was a much needed solution nad was well priced. Service was accomodating, even to free faxed reservations to our next hotel. Breakfast was generous and the room spacious and extremely well presented. Across the road from an interesting former papal residence (fantastic ceiling) and near many tourist attractions. Close to the metro station and walking distance to many places of interest. Only real negative was that there did not appear to be too many good restaurants nearby: needed to go to Spanish Steps/vicinity to find them. Will definitely return and have mentioned to friends already.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Det44
Reviews.Content: This was everything I would expect of a 4 star Hotel: well appointed, clean, good service etc, etc. Although noise from the road can be a problem anywhere in Rome, this Hotel appears to be well insulated against sound disturbance. The location is excellent and within easy walking distance of all the sights and many eating places. There are many delightful small restaurants on the mainly pedestrian lanes from the Hotel, past the Trevi Fountain and down to the Pantheon (the whole route will take only 10 minutes). However, avoid the Zio Ciro restaurant near The Pantheon (poor food, poor service and suspicious and dubious practices)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, accomodation and service.”
Reviews.Author: Wigan_England_Geoff
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a week in Rome. We organised as independent travellers via email and needed special help and advice for an elderly parent in a wheelchair. Whilst Rome is not wheelchair friendly and the Hotel Barberini does not specifically cater for wheelchairs the Hotel staff could not have done more. They organised cars to and from the airport and a wheelchair hire especially for us. The rooms are of a very high standard and the overall service we found 100%. The Hotel does not have a restaurant......... but who needs it with so many on the doorstep. Good varied (hot and cold) breakfast available in the rooftop breakfast room with superb views of Rome. Hot is limited to scrambled egg, rather fatty bacon and hot-dog sausages. Location is 3 mins walk from the Trevi Fountain and only 10 to 15 mins from most other attractions. St Peters is a 15 Euro cab ride. Hotel is a little expensive but reflected in the overall quality. It is not a drinkers hotel as bar prices are prohibitive and we never saw anyone buying alcohol. Bar or room snacks during the day are limited and also expensive. Eat out. Would we stay again? Definitely. By the time we left we were on first name terms with all the staff and felt like family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good if you dont like your belongings”
Reviews.Author: hatleye
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and modern, but the hotel room was robbed while we were out to dinner (less than 2 hours after arrival). There was no forced entry and the windows on the 4th floor are unreachable from the ground. The staff refused to call the police and refused to acknowledge that someone on the staff could do this. They got a laptop, cash, 2 ipod's and a cell phone. If you have no valuables to be stolen, stay there, if you have any thing of value, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: asiahopper
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a lovely romantic honeymoon in Rome, where we stayed for 4 nights in the Barberini. Upon arrival we were greeted with champagne then showed to our room, which was bigger than I expected, as I thought most hotel rooms in Rome would be small, but it was fine. The location is great, just near a Metro line, about an 8 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain and near a bus stop where you can join many sight seeing tours, etc. There are some lovely restaurants just in walking distance of the hotel too. I'd highly recommend the Barberini to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_Haole
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay in Rome, stay at the Hotel Barberini. We booked 2 rooms for 5 people for 2 nights. I can't say enough about the great service, the fantastic location, and the hotel itself. The rooms aren't huge (few are in Europe), but they were a lot larger than we expected. Very comfortable, and very well appointed. We booked directly with the hotel. The communication was excellent, they faxed us with our confirmation within a few minutes. On arrival, our rooms were ready for us, even though we arrived in the late morning. Breakfast was wonderful, a fine selection and as much as you could want. The views from the breakfast room were wonderful. When we wanted to get tickets for the hop-on, hop-off bus, the front desk just reached down and had tickets for us to purchase. How easy is that? The location is close to the Trevi Fountain, and easy walking distance to most everything else, or you can just get on the hop-on, hop-off and go anywhere. Right around the corner from the Hard Rock Cafe, and just up the street from a wonderful English Pub. Many restaurants in the area where you can dine right out on the quaint little streets. When we return to Rome, we will definitely stay at the Barbarini again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sean_e78
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. Clean, comfortable, and nice staff. The breakfast was really nice. Staff were pleasant. The only downside was the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CJFromNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Barberini in June for two nights. I arrived in Rome at 9am, and upon getting out of the cab at the hotel was accosted by a gypsy and her two children who unsuccessfully attempted to pickpocket me. Believe what you hear about them, they are very clever and I caught her with her hand in my front pocket as her 10yr old daughter was trying to distract me by crying and grabbing my arm. I got my money, and the bellman came out and they left. No harm, just be careful. They allowed me to check-in at that early hour, and the room was compact, but clean and up-to-date. It overlooked a small courtyard, but the nice rooftop restaurant had an amazing view of all of rome and decent breakfast and drinks. The bathroom was modern, with a small stall shower, but linens and toiletries were excellent. The lobby is small but pretty, and the hotel is very well located to many sights, including Via Veneto. I definitely recommend this place for a short to medium stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hdy2ftboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently got married and spent our honeymoon in Europe. We spent our last three days and nights in Rome, Italy. My wife had been to Rome in the past and wanted to stay near the Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. She found the Hotel Barberini on the internet and liked the location of the hotel and the fact it was rated a "four star" hotel. My wife booked three nights at the Hotel Barberini and we looked forward to ending our honeymoon in Rome. We checked into the Hotel Barberini and were informed that we had been upgraded to a junior suite instead of our standard room. I had already been warned that hotel rooms in Europe were expensive and small by United States standards. We got into our room and found it to to be very nice, but not great. On our third and last night at the hotel, we came back to our room late in the afternoon to be told by hotel clerk they had moved us to a standard room along with our belongings without our prior knowledge or consent. I expressed my dissatifaction with the hotel clerk. The hotel clerk's attitude was we were lucky to have been upgraded in the first place. I explained to him that I would have been satisfied with our original room, if they were going to go into our room and remove our personal belongings without our prior knowledge or consent. I also explained to the clerk that I could have accepted the room change had we been told at some point there was a possability of a room change. We were never compensated or even given an apology. I am not one to complain, but felt this was wrong and wanted others to know how this hotel treats their customers. I would not recommend the Hotel Barberini in Rome to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “small room, great balcony”
Reviews.Author: atlfamilyof5
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, which is why we stayed here. They room was small, but is typical for Rome. The bathroom was nice. We LOVED our balcony and sat out on it every night, drinking local wine and watching the night life of the city. The breakfast was good, more than some hotels have in Europe. It is a very clean hotel and we would stay there again! I would recommend it for someone who wants a smaller hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodations”
Reviews.Author: rosey57a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at Hotel Barberini for part of our honeymoon. It was a lovely place from the staff to the decor. After our 8 hour flight, we were greeted with a basket of fruit in our room. The room was clean with an in-room safe. At our request, each evening the front desk staff made our dinner reservations. The hotel is within walking distance to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, which made it easy to begin our exploration of Rome from the minute we arrived. I would definitely stay at Hotel Barberini the next time I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: boyleinthebag
Reviews.Content: Booked Hotel through OTEL.com and arranged our own flights. Was my birthday weekend and to avoid problems on arrival I contacted the Hotel at 10pm the night before travelling to enquire about a taxi from Fiumicino to Barberini. They expertly organised a great driver 60 euros to pick us up. We were treated to a history of Rome on the journey in. Great reception at the hotel although the air conditioning wasnt working but it didnt matter.Room was small but well appointed.Breakfast was good with lots of hot & cold choices.coffee was the only downer.Hotel bar is a bit of an afterthought - prob to get the higher star rating but loads of good bars/cafes around anyway. Hotel is well positioned within easy reach of Spanish Steps and Trevi and also very close to the Metro.Very easy to get back to Fiumicino via Metro & train.Would definately return but would ask for room 405 as its a lot bigger that others.Overall a great weekend and had a fantastic meal (with low prices) at Da Francesco in Piazza Fico (near Piazza Navona) its where all the local Romans go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: susandeb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Barberini was a truly lovely experience. Small hotel located in Rome within walking distance of many attractions (across street from Palazzo Barberini) with old time charm. Very happy with room. Staff EXTREMELY polite and helpful. Breakfast (included with room) on rooftop terrace was wonderful way to start the day. Lots of choices for restaurants in immediate area. We left the Barberini to check into another hotel to meet friends only to find reservation was not honored. It was the Barberini staff who were kind and caring enough to take us back for one night and find equivalent accomodations at another hotel for the remainder of our stay. Would definitely stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spencer10
Reviews.Content: We were 8 couples going on a cruise and we needed a hotel to stay at the day before the cruise and the day before we left for home at the end of the cruise. We have all travelled together before and are quite fussy about what we like and how we are treated. We arrived and we were warmly welcomed by the Front Desk and even though we arrived at 1:00 p.m. in the afternoon our rooms were all ready for us and very clean and inviting. The rooms were each a little different ~ some smaller and some larger but overall they were lovely. This is a small boutique hotel and we enjoyed breakfast on their top floor with a beautiful window view of Rome. The breakfast was great. The hotel is located very near the Spanish Steps and a great location to walk anywhere. We all enjoyed our stay at this hotel and found the staff very helpful and accommodating. The night of our return to Rome before departing home was a little disappointing in that it was very hot and the airconditioning had broken down in the rooms. However, the staff worked very hard to get it in some working order by the time we returned from dinner. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: rentiu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very bad stay at Hotel H2000, so we start looking around for another hotel to move in. It just happened this hotel was one block away from the H2000. We walked into this hotel and were impressed by the kind and polite staff at the front desk. The person at the front desk even volunteer to show us one of the empty rooms. Needles to say we moved into this hotel right away, and we were able to enjoy the rest of the stay in Rome. Rooms are very spacious (for Rome), quiet, and very clean. There are also in-room safes. Just to tell you how caring this place is toward their guests, in our last day, we made arrangements with the front desk to have a mini-van take us to the airport at 4:00 AM in the morning. We got downstairs at 3:30 AM and took a seat in the lobby. The front desk person came to us and asked us if we need some coffee, which we did. He went upstairs to the bar (which was closed at that hour) and got us our coffees. The van was on time as promised as well! I would highly recommend this hotel to others. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jason_L_D
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor, Gibraltar My wife and I recently stayed in the Barberini Hotel for three nights, and I must admit after spending Hours on the internet looking through endless reviews we made the right choice by choosing this Hotel. First of all is the location, which is all important in Rome. It is literally 5min walk from the Trevi Fountain, 15min to the Coloseum and a short walk to the Spanish Steps. The Hotel itself is very nice and clean and very good quality, throughout, although our room was on the small side and our bathroom had a shower/ no bath, but that was not really a problem. The staff were excellent at all times and very friendly especially the breakfast staff in the Terrace which served us. The breakfast was very good although going up for a drink can be quite expensive. The views from the Terrace are beautiful, We quite recommend it. To summarize, We highly recommed this Hotel and cannot wait to go back !

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back here!”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning and our room was not ready. The man at the desk said, our room was not ready, but it would be worth the wait because they were upgrading us to junor suite. As we were getting ready to leave the hotel, he told me that his manager said that there was too much work to do on it and we would not get the upgrade. I told him that we were going out for the day and that we would be glad to wait. He said no, our regular room was ready and that was what we would be assigned to. So, we were taken to a nice, somewhat small room with a very nice bathroom. Needless to say, I was disappointed. If he would just not have said anything, I would have been much happier. That was the only downside of this entire experience I certainly didn't let it spoil the overall impression of the hotel The location of the hotel is great. We walked to everything. However, sometimes we would be tired and take a cab. the cab drivers have a little difficulty finding the hotel because it is down a little side street.. Make sure that you know the landmarks to help them get you there or do as we did, get out at the major corner and walk the last block or so. Just down the street on Via Rusella is a restaurant recommended by Rick Steves. We thoroughly enjoyed it. It is called Hostel Romano. It is a half a block away. Another time we ate lunch at the nationale Cafeteria about two blocks away on Via Nationale. We were the only tourists in there. Very good, extremely reasonable and is also recommended by Rick Steves. The view at breakfast is fantastic! The waiters were friendly and always accomodating. Certainly enough selection for everyone to find things to eat for a filling breakfast. The lobby is welcoming when you enter. All the hotel staff were courteous and helpful. We are going back to Rome in April and will definitely be staying at the Barberini Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mikestravels
Reviews.Content: Returned from three nights at this hotel in late Septmeber. What a find! many thanks to all previous reviewers for your help in me picking this hotel. Room size was great (room 405) - much bigger I think than their average room size so request this if you can! Found it very hard to book as I could not find availability on any websites, but then stumbled across GTA.com (I think) and got the last room. So close to all the major attractions (accept the Vatican) - 5 mins walk to Trevi, 10 mins to Colisseum and in a very safe area. Would highly recommend a little bar round the corner called Alberts (I think!) - just walk down the hill, turn right and the opening to the bar is just there - we met loads of people from all over the world, just chatting over a sociable beer! Prices in Rome for drinks was very expensive but food was not too bad if you wandered around a bit. The cost of the hotel was expensive compared to other cities, but this seemed to be the case for all the hotels we considered and the Barberini was by no means the most expensive in Rome. We were delighted with this gem of a hotel - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnystar
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, my only complaint was that I didnt get longer to stay here! I booked it for the first night of our trip for my 30th Birthday so I actually woke up here on my birthday and had a lovely view from our room and at breakfast on the rooftop. Our flights had been cancelled which meant we arrived late and missed half a day and a night. We were tired and just went straight to bed. The room was nice, it was quiet and had a lovely bathroom. The recpetion area was welcoming and clean, the breakfast room was a treat and had a great selection of food. I can highly recommend this hotel, it was abit more pricy than the next hotel we stayed in, but to be honest if I had the money it would have been worth paying the extra just for the comfort. Location was excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a central location with perfect service”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1140
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Barberini very much and found it to be a very good hotel with very good service in a central location in Rome. Personell manages somehow to help 3 clients at the same time and still manage to serve them all well. All are very helpfull and seemed to be reading our minds, which made our stay very relaxing, a real vacation. Okay the rooms (and beds) are a bit bijou like any hotel room/bed in Rome, but they are well equiped and practical. Very silent airco, you can even leave it on during the night without any (draft)problem! Furthermore we found an enourmous fruit basket with a personal note from the manager upon arrival in our room, with a sideway's view of St. Peters Basilica from our little balcony. What a great way to start a holiday in beautiful Rome. And yes, they do serve a breakfast to die for in their roof garden with fantastic views of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ellise
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 days at this hotel. This was my second trip to Rome in 2 yrs, so I am able to make comparisons. From Ciampino airport to the Hotel Barberini is max 45 euros. Take a registered white metered cab outside the airport otherwise you will get ripped off. If you intend on using taxis around Rome only take the white cabs. The hotel is less than a 5 min walk from Piazza Barberini where plenty of shops/restaurants can be found. The hotel is ideally placed for walking to the Trevi Fountain (beware - pick-pockets!), Pantheon and Spanish Steps. All within 5-15 mins. Taxi to the Vatican costs max 10 euros but this is within a 40 min walk. The main shopping area is Via Del Corso, 5 mins walk. The hotel is modern, clean and most of the staff are fairly friendly/accommodating. Rooms are on the small side but this is to be expected from Italian hotels. Our party of 4 stayed in a suite and the bathroom was spacious comprising a jacuzzi bath. Both rooms were very clean. The only area that could be improved upon was the menu. Breakfast was average. Buffet style cold meats, cheese, cakes but the cooked breakfast left a lot to be desired. No traditional toast, just French toast in a packet! However, the view from the Breakfast room was spectacular. Room service menu was poor, lacking in variety. It was easier to walk 2 mins to buy a snack! The purpose of this trip was for a special celebration and although known by the hotel there was no complimentary gift. Would recommend this hotel, subject to you not having a healthy aappetite.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmation in Hand, No Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: LIZNewYork
Reviews.Content: Even arriving at Hotel Barberini with a confirmation in hand for our stay, could not get us a room for our first night in Rome. The hotel offered a solution: My husband and I could sleep on a pull out sofa in the room of our traveling companions. Sorry, Hotel Barberini...this is NOT a solution. It took the staff an hour to find another hotel room.... on the other side of town. They agreed to pay the room price difference and cab fare to and from, but the aggravation, disappointment and frustration outwayed anything that was offered. Also, the general manager was extremely unprofessional and disrespectful, refusing to speak to me because he said I was too hysterical! He did agree to speak with my husband to resolve the issue. Hey, Mr Hotel Barberini General Manager, "Pick your knuckles up off the floor!" While the hotel was clean and in a good location, this mishap has soured my relationship with this hotel. Fair warning to all those seeking a room with a confirmation! Also, I booked this hotel through travel-to-italy.com. When I expressed the series of events that happened with the hotel, they were not sympathetic to giving me some type of credit for my inconvenience. Their response was mistakes happen, we are all human! Customer service at it's finest!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barberini over the Easter Break for our Wedding Anniversary. Hotel staff were very helpful (Arranged for Airport pick-up and a nice bottle of Champagne waiting in our room on arrival). The rooms were fairly small but were well furnished and very clean. Bathroom was very nice. The Breakfast was one of the best we have experienced in Rome. The location is perfect, near the Metro and walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Pantheon. There's a great restaurant near the Spanish Steps called LaRampa (You have to try their Self-Service Anti-Pasta!!). Go down the steps and turn left, There is a small square to your left, the restaurant is tucked away in the far left hand corner. Prices are reasonable and their food is terrific. We also went on the Angels tour (As recommended in the Mail on Sunday), Jenny was excellent on the Roman Forum and Coliseum tour and Louisa was great at the Pantheon. Although pestered by the local guides, the girls did a great job. I am sure you will enjoy your stay at the Barberini!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelHag
Reviews.Content: The Barberini is an above average hotel! What we like about the Barberini is the LOCATION - walking distance the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via de Corso, the Metro, a 24 hour internet cafe, etc.The staff is also very accomodating and friendly. The rooms as mentioned, are your standard "European sized" hotel rooms with two twin beds, however the bathroom was huge! Which took up most of the "room!" Other than size the only other problem was the lack of air circulation and the air conditioning was not operating! The breakfast on the roof top terrace was lovely with views of the city, including St. Peter's! A great restaurant down the street was Colline Emmiliane. Room rates were manageable, but I wish the dollar was doing much better!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms, fair value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room: Average European sized rooms, but the bathroom was marble and good-sized. The shower itself is small though. The room has sound-proof windows so there is no worry about street noise even if you are facing the streets. Breakfast: Good breakfast selection that should not disappoint most. Location: Excellent location about 2 blocks from the Metro (Barberini) and bus stations. About 10-15 minutes walking to Spanish steps. Like everywhere in Rome, you can basically walk there. Taxi from train station with 2 pieces of luggage was 10 Euros and took 10 minutes. Internet cafe right next to Metro entrance. Service: Good and prompt. Andrea was very nice. Restaurant recommendation only fair though as we felt like we were in the US since the one recommended (Tullio, about a 5 minute walk) was packed with Americans. Value: Comparing to the other places in Rome, the value was fair though not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place & the best location!”
Reviews.Author: fashion_teacher99
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can say if that this hotel was PERFECT!!!! Yes, the rooms are small, but welcome to Europe! The staff was so helpful with directions, reservations, car service, I could go on and on. The location was within walking distance from everything. We did not take a cab anywhere. We stayed in great hotels all over Italy this summer and this one was the best. Breakfast was great and had a lot of variety. I would highly recommend this hotel it is worth it 10 times over.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was VERY small- only a few feet of space around the bed. The hotel is in a good location-walking to the spanish steps and trevi fountain was a nice evening. The "bar" across the street on the way to piazza barberini was superb for coffee- and excellent panini sandwiches for a quick bite. The room was very clean and quiet though.

Reviews.Title: “Going back for seconds”
Reviews.Author: LSUTENNISNUT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barberini for our honeymoon in March 2000. The hotel was perfect!!! The staff was very friendly. The rooms were very nice. We never had a bad meal at any of the restaurants nearby the hotel. One of the best hotels we stayed at in Italy. We loved the Barberini so much that in August 2005 we are staying there for 2 nights. We highly recommend the Hotel Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “barberini - great!”
Reviews.Author: BelfastTraveller80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barberini 17 March - 21 March 2005. It is in a a really good location for exploring historic Rome, and the service is first class. The staff are friendly and efficient and we can thoroughly recomend the hotel - we would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the Barberini”
Reviews.Author: marlaNY
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent three nights at the Barberini in late November 2004. It's fine location and amenable staff made our Thanksgiving holiday even more pleasurable. The rooms were comfortable - on the small side - but amply furnished; the bathrooms large and very well-maintained. Very good restaurant recommendations nearby. Located one block from the metro (Piazza Barberini) and Via Veneto; five minutes from the Trevi and walking distance to all. Well-priced off-season rate which included a buffet breakfast. Arriverderci Roma!

Reviews.Title: “We were really pleased with the Barberini”
Reviews.Author: Silver traveller from Cornwall
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to Rome, but 1st time at The Barberini. My wife and I liked everything about the hotel. Reception staff were efficient, friendly and very polite, every day. Breakfast room staff too, were polite and professional. The buffet breakfast gave a good range of food, from cereals, fruit, croissants, bacon-egg-sausage etc. Very cleanly presented. Our room was small, but tastefully furnished. Everything about the hotel, looked clean and well maintained. Well located - approx 5mins walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain & the shops. We enjoyed an end of day drink in the 6th floor, rooftop bar. A small hotel with a BIG positive result for us. We hope one day to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Barberini Hotel is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 recntly stayed at the Barberini Hotel for 4 nights. It is a lovely hotel in a great location with an excellent, attentive and helpful staff. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in the Barberini in June in a Junior Suite. Wonderful location -5mins walk from Spanish Steps/ Trevi Fountain. Rooms quiet and cool in 31 degrees heat. Service friendly and helpful. A great value hotel in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were just here in April 2004 for 3 nights. If you are a walker, the location is perfect ... 10 minutes from Trevi, top or bottom of Spanish Steps, Via Veneto. 10 minutes more gets you to Via Corso, Villa Borghese, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, etc. And the hotel staff couldn't be nicer. Quiet location, good breakfast. The rooftop breakfast terazza opens in May, so we missed it .. but it is beautiful up there. Would stay here again, or recommend to anyone in a heartbeat. Pricey, but so is all of central Rome. Only if you have your heart set on staying in a particular location ... Trastavere, Vatican, Forum Area, Campo di Fiori .. would I hesistate.
